question.title: How do i solve JavaFX project not running on Mac, module not found
question.body:
I'm working on a JavaFX project with a team. I have never ran this before. Everyone is on Windows OS except me, I'm on macOS.

One of my teammates started the project and pushed it on GitHub. For everyone else it worked immediately, but I'm having some problems.

Although everyone is probably using JavaFX 17 with JDK 22 and a warning appears, I was getting some errors too and was unable to run it. I then downloaded JavaFX 24 and JDK 23. Not I'm getting the following error:

Error occurred during initialization of boot layer
java.lang.module.FindException: Module bingespice_app not found

Process finished with exit code

My project structure is shown below

The module-info.java:

module bingespice_app {
    requires javafx.controls;
    requires javafx.fxml;
    requires javafx.web;

    requires org.controlsfx.controls;
    requires com.dlsc.formsfx;
    requires net.synedra.validatorfx;
    requires org.kordamp.ikonli.javafx;
    requires org.kordamp.bootstrapfx.core;
    requires eu.hansolo.tilesfx;
    requires com.almasb.fxgl.all;
    requires java.desktop;

    opens com.example.bingespice_app to javafx.fxml;
    exports com.example.bingespice_app;
}

And pom.xml:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.example</groupId>
    <artifactId>bingespice_app</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <name>bingespice_app</name>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <junit.version>5.10.2</junit.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-controls</artifactId>
            <version>17.0.6</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-fxml</artifactId>
            <version>17.0.6</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-web</artifactId>
            <version>17.0.6</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-swing</artifactId>
            <version>17.0.6</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-media</artifactId>
            <version>17.0.6</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.controlsfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>controlsfx</artifactId>
            <version>11.2.1</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.dlsc.formsfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>formsfx-core</artifactId>
            <version>11.6.0</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                    <artifactId>*</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>net.synedra</groupId>
            <artifactId>validatorfx</artifactId>
            <version>0.5.0</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                    <artifactId>*</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.kordamp.ikonli</groupId>
            <artifactId>ikonli-javafx</artifactId>
            <version>12.3.1</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.kordamp.bootstrapfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>bootstrapfx-core</artifactId>
            <version>0.4.0</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>eu.hansolo</groupId>
            <artifactId>tilesfx</artifactId>
            <version>21.0.3</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                    <artifactId>*</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.github.almasb</groupId>
            <artifactId>fxgl</artifactId>
            <version>17.3</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                    <artifactId>*</artifactId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit-jupiter-api</artifactId>
            <version>${junit.version}</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
            <version>${junit.version}</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.code.gson</groupId>
            <artifactId>gson</artifactId>
            <version>2.10.1</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.13.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>23</source>
                    <target>23</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
                <artifactId>javafx-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.0.8</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <!-- Default configuration for running with: mvn clean javafx:run -->
                        <id>default-cli</id>
                        <configuration>
                            <mainClass>com.example.bingeSpice_app/com.example.bingeSpice_app.Main
                            </mainClass>
                            <launcher>app</launcher>
                            <jlinkZipName>app</jlinkZipName>
                            <jlinkImageName>app</jlinkImageName>
                            <noManPages>true</noManPages>
                            <stripDebug>true</stripDebug>
                            <noHeaderFiles>true</noHeaderFiles>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

I have tried VM options, I have moved the module-info in different locations. I have tried to edit some capital letters to lowercase as shown before (the module name in the beginning was Bingespice_App). What am I doing wrong?

Please don't send links to other posts, the only one that I have found that was relative was someone with HelloFX and it had something to do with out folder but I don't even have one.

question_comments.body: Your module name is (in the module-info) is bingespice_app. In the JavaFX maven plugin config, you have <mainClass>com.example.bingeSpice_app/com.example.bingeSpice‌​_app.Main</mainClass‌​>. There is an inexplicable new line in the XML value, which might be ok or might not. The stuff before the slash is a module name, it needs to match case (it doesn't) it needs not to be qualified as your module name is not qualified (it is qualified).
"The module-info.java is the original unchanged." -> It isn't though, the blue colors for the module-info and pom in the IDE screenshot show the files have been changed.

When do you get java.lang.module.FindException: Module bingespice_app not found, how are you trying to run the app, what is the exact text of the command used? (if running in the IDE, the IDE console will show the command if you expand it by clicking on ... in the first line of the console). Edit the question add the info.

As I said before, I do not believe “All the other team members just pulled from github and it worked.”. If your module-info.java file works on Windows OS, it will work on macOS, it will work on Linux, it will work on BSD, it will work on AIX, etc. The module-info.java has nothing to do with host OS.

What I would do is (A) use the IntelliJ template feature for JavaFX to create a brand new working project. I would compare that module-info.java file to your own. Fix, letting IntelliJ advise along the way. (B) Then I would change the POM to use the latest JavaFX (24) with the latest Java (24), while planning to deploy on 25 of both. JavaFX has been rapidly evolving, with significant changes and improvements between versions. (C) Then I would investigate why your module includes java.desktop. That is part of Swing, and it’s best to not mix Swing and JavaFX unless absolutely necessary.

@BasilBourque The module-info.java is the original unchanged. All the other team members  just pulled from github and it worked. What i found out is that although i added JavaFX to the library and modules on project structure, it still used JavaFX 17 (maybe its built in?). The other team members also use intellij and they all get a warning that they use JavaFX 17 on javafx 23 API. If we assume that i just want to make it work for myself, what changes do i need to make on POM? Or is there a fix for the error i mentioned on my other post that you also commented?

Regarding versions, your POM says you are using Java 23. And you are using JavaFX 17.0.6 which is not the latest patch version, 17.0.14. By the way, if you are on Java 23, then you could be using JavaFX/OpenJFX 24 rather than 17, I don’t know of any reason not to. Eventually you will likely want to deploy using the LTS versions of both: 17, 21, & likely 25.

Did the rest of your team edit the module-info.java file? That file is Java-specific, and OS-independent. Running on a Mac versus a PC should not matter to the Java Platform Module System. Your entire team should all be using the very same module-info.java file. I would guess your other team members edited their copy to get the app to work. Those edits should be posted back to GitHub for all the team to be using the same. Ditto for your POM file.
"probably using JavaFX 17 with JDK 22" — You should know this for certain. Your POM should control both.
Are you and the rest of the team all using IntelliJ? All using the same version? Which version?

Please take more care in your writing when posting here. This site is meant to be more like Wikipedia, less like a casual chatroom. So use proper case and punctuation, etc. Edit your prose for clarity. And properly format your code snippets. Either intent all lines of code by four SPACE characters or wrap in a pair of lines that have nothing but three back-ticks plus optional language name. Study the edits I made to clean up your Question.
